newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE grains lower amid pre-EU export pessimism.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE grains lower amid pre-EU export pessimism.

text.p: LIFFE grains fell on Thursday amid trade fears that the immediate export outlook might not be as good as thought.
Active May wheat fell 2.00 sterling to 98.75 stg per tonne on volume of 313 lots. Total wheat volume was 820 lots.
Lacklustre bidding ahead of the EU tender failed to inspire, and market players appear to be getting the idea that March exports were not as good as hoped, one trader said.
Early in the day shipper selling on May put the old crop under pressure, with the new crop also forced down. "Long liquidation was a feature throughout the day," the shipper said.
Export woes contributed to an easier supply situation. "It doesn't help when there is grain coming forward in the countryside," he said
On barley, November was the most active month, with 44 of 49 lots traded. It last changed hands 0.75 stg lower at 95.50 stg.
